newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest direct hogs seen flat-up $0.50 -dealers.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest direct hogs seen flat-up $0.50 -dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Wednesday were seen steady to $0.50 per cwt higher, lifted by continued light hog supplies and a slight advance in wholesale pork prices, livestock dealers said.

Top cash prices for interior Iowa and southern Minnesota hogs at packing plants were seen ranging from $51.50 to $52.00 and Illinois top prices at plants could span $50.50 to $51.00, sources in those areas said.
Indiana/Ohio plant prices were seen at $50.50 to $51.00.
This week's advance in hog prices brought out a few more marketings, but they remained below packer needs, they said.
Tight hog supplies and unfavorable market conditions spurred production cutbacks by several packers.
IBP Inc on Monday announced it was cutting the second shift at its Columbus Junction, Iowa plant on March 3 and ceasing slaughter April 24 at its Council Bluffs, Iowa plant.
ConAgra Inc cut pork production by one hour a day at its three Swift and Co. pork plants Monday and Tuesday and would review schedules for the rest of the week.
Smithfield Foods Inc's John Morrell hog slaughter plant in Sioux City, Iowa continues to operate one shift after cutting its second shift in early February.
Company officials said it has not been determined when the second shift will be reinstated.
